result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrian Gerard Gray

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Adrian Gerard Gray

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:42 PM Defendant Adrian Gerard Gray appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Hoffman makes special appearance. Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case. Address updated. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, asks for prelim.
State requests $5000 cash, conditions of no drugs or drug paraphernalia. Placed on probation in October 2021, currently in absconder status. Cites other priors. 
Attorney Hoffman indicates resides in Superior, lifelong resident of area. Family is lifelong residents. Nominal amount of money to post.
Court orders $1500 cash, with conditions of no use or possession of controlled substances or drug related paraphernalia.
Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver as knowingly and voluntarily made.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
